H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6662.def: = state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

H5000.def: = state in which humans or parts of their body are considered physically attractive

H3477.def: = state in which objects are without a bend or curve

H8416.def: = action by which humans express their appreciation, admiration, respect, and/or gratitude to deities about who they are and what they do

H3034.def: literally: to confess (God's) name; hence: = action by which humans publicly admit their own shortcomings before God, or the shortcomings of the people they represent

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3658.def: = musical instrument consisting of a sound box ◄ made of wood, out of the ends or sides of which projected two arms; the arms supported a crosspiece; strings descended from the crosspiece over the sound box and the number of strings could vary; ► often used to accompany singing

H2167.def: = action by which one expresses one's respect and gratitude to someone else by uttering words at a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not

H5035.def: = container ◄ made of a goatskin, the outer side of which has been turned inside; ► used for storing wine

H7891.def: = action by which one utters words with a set or improvised tune, whether accompanied by musical instruments and dancing or not

H2319.def: = state in which an object has been in existence for only a short time ◄ because of having recently been built or produced

H5059.def: = action by which humans play an instrument with strings, such as a {L:lute<SDBH:כִּנֹּור>} or {L:lyre<SDBH:נֵבֶל>}, which can be for silent meditation or to accompany singing and dancing

H3190.def: = causative action by which humans cause objects to be in a better state of maintenance than before

H8643.def: = loud sound ◄ produced either by the human voice or by musical instruments ► used to express an emotion or to communicate something to a community

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3477.def: = state in which objects are without a bend or curve

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H530.def: = state in which an object does not move

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H3664.def: causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or objects to come together in one location

H5067.def: = a large quantity of water, staying together as one heap as if it were a solid substance

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H8415.def: = great body of water located around and under the surface of the earth; when the world was newly created this water used to cover the earth as well; the subterranean water comes up to the surface of the earth through springs

H214.def: = valuable goods in one's possession; ≈ falsely considered a source of well-being

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3372.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H8398.def: primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans

H1481.def: = state in which humans live in a place that is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6331.def: = causative action by which deities cause the plans humans not to succeed

H5106.def: = causative action by which humans use their influence or authority to keep something from happening

H4284.def: = procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H4284.def: = procedure for achieving a certain purpose, originating from someone's לֵב mind

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

H5159.def: = process by which possessions are transferred from one generation to the next

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5027.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H4349.def: = a firm location, suitable for building upon; ≈ often used for the place where the temple of God was built

H7688.def: = action by which humans or deities fix their eyes on an object for a prolonged period of time

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H3467.def: = action by which humans or deities help themselves in a (difficult) situation

H1368.def: = a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H3581.def: = state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

H5483.def: = large domesticated solid-hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H8668.def: = causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue of humans in need

H4422.def: = action by which humans move away as fast as possible from a place that is considered insecure ► in order to save their lives

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3373.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H3176.def: = action by which humans delay action until the right moment, with a certain amount of confidence that this moment will actually come

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H2421.def: = process by which humans are alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity

H7458.def: = state of having a lack of food for a period of time, affecting an individual for a short time or a large number of people in a geographical area for a prolonged time (as in famine)

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H2442.def: = action by which humans or deities consciously remain in a particular state

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5828.def: = action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non-military contexts)  ► in order to make their life or work or task easier

H4043.def: = a flat, usually round, object; made of wood or metal; ► used in battle; held by a warrior in front of him as protection from the weapons of his opponent; relatively small and easy to maneuver; ≈ associated with protection and therefore often used as an epithet for God

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H8055.def: = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H2617.def: = state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3176.def: = action by which humans delay action until the right moment, with a certain amount of confidence that this moment will actually come
